abstract: Exports rose 12.7 percent in November compared with last year, far higher than expectations, and analysts say it could be more evidence the Chinese economy is recovering.
snippet: Exports rose 12.7 percent in November compared with last year, far higher than expectations, and analysts say it could be more evidence the Chinese economy is recovering.
lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — China’s exports rose more than expected last month, government figures released Sunday showed, as resurgent demand from consumers in the United States and the European Union helped put the Asian manufacturing juggernaut on track for its biggest annual trade surplus since 2008.

headline.main: Export Surge Sets Up Big Surplus for China
headline.print_headline: Export Surge Sets Up Big Surplus for China
